website_summaries.verdict: A solid, great-looking keyboard with a lot of features for those willing to spend a little more.
pros: Gamers love how you can download color profiles for specific games
Key letter sizes enhance the lighting effects
We love the tactile feel of the keys
cons: Some buyers have noted that keys can start doubling or tripling letters when you press them

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I owned a original K70 with red switches for 5 years. I loved it, but decided to take it to work for typing so for home I purchased a K99. I later ended up selling that K70 due to workplace change. The K95 had speed switches and they were just too shallow and easy to press. I had too many fat-finger incidents and my typing was hampered. I like the brown switches more than the reds. They can be a little loud but I am fine with that. They are pleasure to type on. To any one considering the K95 or speed switches, please get this instead. It smashes the speed switches both in feeling and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N

customer_reviews.title: I thought the Cherry MX brown was supposed to be Quiet?
customer_reviews.text: After completing my due diligence, I came to a conclusion that I wanted the tactile, quiet keyboard which meant the Cherry MX brown. When i received the keyboard, the typing was so loud that I initially thought I received the wrong one, perhaps a normal MX cherry. But nope, there's a sticker that clearly indicates cherry brown. Overall, a solid keyboard but I definitely wish it was quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Sau Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Letter's broke off after 9 months. Looking at the broken key, they use obviously used cheap plastic. Then started repeating random characters across the entire keyboard. Warranty say's doesn't cover normal wear and tear, but I plan making sure the top search result for their company is this review if they refuse to replace. Will update review after I receive their answer. Worked great until it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Review

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff - I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I tried this keyboard at work and loved it, so I ended up buying it again for my home. The iCUE software was farily easy to use and set up lighting just the way I like it (very dim and with only frequently used keys lit up in different color groups). I would have loved a tenkeyless version of this keyboard - I never use the keypad buttons, and having more desk space would be a good thing, but they only had a tenkeyless with red switches when I bought it, not brown which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Imrys

customer_reviews.title: The sleek black aluminum makes it seem durable and better than most of any other keyboards I've ever used ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really liking the way it looks and feels when typing on it. The sleek black aluminum makes it seem durable and better than most of any other keyboards I've ever used before. The click-clack also reminds me of the old keyboards I used to use. I would say it has a modern and simple look that seem to focus more on actual practicality than complex options found in most other gaming keyboards. I would have rated it 5 stars if it weren't for some weird problem with the lights that won't turn off on some of the keys sometimes when I shutdown my computer.
customer_reviews.author: WEDemingFan

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a free mechanical keyboard, went from red to brown switches. Not only quieter but so much easier to purposefully initiate a keystroke. With the reds, I had a lot of spelling errors because they had no activation bump, and were so easy to press by accident. Cut my errors at least in half because of them, very satisfying keystrokes, and the design is phenomenal. Only had this for a day but I know it will be very easy to clean, no recesses that will trap particles, hair or dust. Some people complain about the wrist rest, I think its great but that might vary based on your desk, posture and personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: maBlocher

customer_reviews.title: Cheap posts on keycaps, no support......
customer_reviews.text: A keycap broke after only 4 months of normal use. Corsair support is almost non-existent. Email after email all you will receive is a response saying your replacement is on the way....but it never is sent out. A++ for saying you will replace a defective part. F-- for actually doing it. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Great feel. Great look.  Well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good mechanical keyboard. The only thing that took me some time to get used to and that may bother you is the spring pressure on the MX Browns is a bit higher that I was used to on my old membrane kb. If I were to buy again, I would probably look for a lighter spring, but this is a preference thing and in no way affects the function. The keys are not super noisy, but you can certainly tell that someone is typing or gaming. Not for use if you near someone trying to sleep (if they are easily disturbed). RGB looks great. Lot's of patterns and good color control.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Giordano

customer_reviews.title: K70 LUX (Red Backlight) Keyboard First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: *Adjustable backlight brightness in Corsair ICUE Software; *Needed a firmware update from version 2.x.x to 3.0.8 after initially receiving from Amazon; *Didn’t initially play well until all old keyboard drivers were uninstalled, and the computer rebooted, and then worked flawlessly; *Back-lighting could be slightly better for the number row and number pad, as well as for the media control keys, including the mute button; *Good, audible, sound level from key actuation; *A little bit “tight” layout for someone with larger hands, especially compared to my last keyboard; and *Overall a solid keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Stryker

customer_reviews.title: Nice tactile feel, modest noise, space hogging software
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit a lot for typing. My only complaint is the multi-color, changing color pattern that for a gamer may be sexy but all I want is muted background lighting for nocturnal use, say a dull green. Such requires the ICUE software, which works fine but embeds in the boot menu and slows boot-up....yeah, my computer runs at 4ghz plus has tons of memory (boot time about 10 seconds total) but it seems unreasonable to slow the boot more than anything else in my boot menu....and I have lots of programs....yeah, I'm just nit-picking, and hence for an honest review I must admit it.
customer_reviews.author: osguthjd

customer_reviews.title: CUSTOMIZE your keycaps? Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things about spending money on Cherry switches is the infinite amount of ways that you can customize your keys. You CANNOT do this with the Corsairs because they have a non standard bottom row (for no apparent reason). Totally frustrated to discover this after pulling off all the caps to change the heavy keys for newer better caps.
customer_reviews.author: BuffPuff

customer_reviews.title: awesome feeling keyboard; great leds; not too 'clicky' sounding
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Razer Blackwidow ultimate 2012 keyboard, you can really see a significant better build quality. All the keys feel great, the leds look great and I find myself using the volume and video controls often. The only con I can think of would be one of the little pieces next to the volume adjuster wiggles around slightly and has been like that out of the box. Not a big issue for me but I can see how it might annoy some customers. I am very happy with this keyboard and recently bought a corsair mouse to go along with the keyboard. side note: the ICUE software has a slight learning curve but tutorials are easily found on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Cherry MX browns and excellent build quality make this the best mechanical keyboard for the price. The keys are very well made and the RGB system that Corsair has is one of the best if not the best one in terms of customization it offers. Also worth noting the keyboard has on board memory so you dont need the iCUE software to get the most out your keyboard. You can even save your customization and uninstall the iCUE after uploading the profiles to the keyboard. My only wish was that the lights were a little bit brighter
customer_reviews.author: HLF

customer_reviews.title: Not a standard keyboard layout, and spacing is a lot closer than normal
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of good reviews on this product, and if it was my only keyboard I use I would give it a 5 star. However, my biggest problem is with Corsair's decision to not stay with standard spacing of the keys, and subsequently the smaller tops of the keys themselves. the function keys are also a lot closer to the keyboard than normal which causes confusion as I go from keyboard to keyboard (I have a couple hundred computers at my work that I share with a lot of other people).... My only assumption on why Corsair decided to make this decision would be that they didn't want to pay for the additional materials...
customer_reviews.author: TheLynx

customer_reviews.title: I see the light!!! 5 star.....returning for RGB version.
customer_reviews.text: From only using laptop keyboards (.....pre-built/OEM...like a lot of HP laptops).... i will never go back!. ' This is my 1st mechanical keyboard with Cherry MX switches.... ( I checked a lot of comparisons video between the others options and i felt Brown would be best for me and i have no complaints But sad to say........ i had to return this one only because........i bought the Red back-light only keyboard..... instead of the RGB version..... yes i did it for the RGB..... this will be used with my future 1st PC build....soooo everything must be right!
customer_reviews.author: Terrence M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, exactly what I was looking for!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all around keyboard. The action is light, so it's great for gaming. However, the light action does still do a good job of allowing your fingers to feel the bump to know if the action is complete or not. For some the action might be too light, so a clear or tactile grey may be a better option for stronger hands or someone who wants a very clear response. There are times when I'm typing fast that I think the action isn't strong enough. The RGB and windows button lock are awesome for gaming. It's been a great experience so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For Work and Gaming
customer_reviews.text: A keyboard for gaming? Check. A keyboard for typing for work? Also check. This is a keyboard that does both of those things well. The comfort of the keys bundled with the Cherry MX switches make this the mechanical keyboard to have. The keys hold up well to daily use for work and respond instantly during a gaming session. The RGB lighting in the keyboard is a great added feature to an already outstanding product. The passthrough USB port is also a nice touch. Useful for a mouse receiver or a flash drive. The price may seem high to many people. This is the best keyboard money you could buy. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parduhn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for work and I love it. Just a joy to type on. Not too loud but still responsive and tactile with a satisfying click. The keyboard feels solidly built as well and the lighting effects are nice, although I don't like the iCUE software very much. I would buy this keyboard again without a second thought if I needed another general keyboard. Overall, I like typing on this keyboard more than my razer blackwidow chroma v2 at home. However, I do like playing games on my blackwidow more than than the corsair. Also the razer wrist rest blows the corsair wrist rest out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Review from a K95 Platinum owner
customer_reviews.text: Idk. I was expected for this to be exactly like the K95 Platinum minus the lightbar, macro keys, and slightly different wrist rest. The build quality doesnt seem as solid, the plastic wrist rest has no rubber coating on it like the platinum, and the keys don't feel as nice - they seem stiffer. Maybe I'm being paranoid but I'd probably just get another K95 Platinum if I had the chance. I guess the only improvement over the K95 is that you can light up the Corsair logo (on the Platinum you have to use the lightbar to do so)
customer_reviews.author: C. Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Best quality upgrade I’ve ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best “luxury” standard of living upgrade I’ve ever made for a standard office environment. It makes typing all of those annoying emails almost enjoyable. Note this is with the MX Brown switches. I do think any of the louder switches would be too much for an open office environment, but the Browns are perfect. Just enough to tell your boss “I’m busy, leave me alone”, without being overbearing. It truly feels like a luxury piece, with the key weight that exudes quality. I’ve played a couple games on it and it’s obviously excellent at that, but I think the office worker looking for higher quality tool of the trade couldn’t go wrong here!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.JoeSchmoe

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard Just wouldn't pay more than $120 for it
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is nice and flashy, just the way I wanted, wouldn't take it to work but for my home desktop, it works perfectly. My inner child gets true joy from all the ways you can manipulate the lighting settings. Reviewers always nock this keyboard for its software being too complicated but I have found that it allows for complex lightings. The software is extremely comprehensive and gives the user full lighting control on every little detail and action for every individual key. The reviews must just not be smart enough to use the software :P
customer_reviews.author: logan

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, not for multiple operating systems - No input at BIOS/boot time
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for single OS like Windows (using the Corsair iCUE software) or Mac and Linux (using ckb-next). The only caveats are that there is no connectivity during boot time, and there the need for an additional process running for the keyboard. On the other versions this board, there is a switch on the back that can be adjusted for input during boot. The one I got didn't have the switch so I wasn't able to access my grub options or system bios and the keyboard isn't available until the operating system is booted. I had to return it. It has a nice metal base and that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: rgreene

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality, good feel
customer_reviews.text: VERY picky gamer who has always used Razer and he LOVES this keyboard. Amazon was great- the tracking indicated that the item was left "in the mail room"- there is no mail room where he lives... so they sent another one right out without question, no clue what happened to the other one. It ships in a box that has a picture and description on the outside of the box- thinking delivery person may have helped themselves. Maybe they need to box it differently. It's expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Kean

customer_reviews.title: The keycap stems break after a while, and the replacement keyset about half the original price
customer_reviews.text: As it says in the headline, I love this keyboard and I could tolerate replacing the keycaps. However, the corresponding replacement keycaps are around half the price of the keyboard, which is unacceptable when the keycaps are this delicate. Update: Ordered Third party keycaps and the space bar wouldn't fit. After some research I found out that Corsair modified their keys to unorthodox key sizes, with a very unusual space bar size. My only guess as to why they did this was to coerce their customers into buying their expensive and delicate keycap set. Probably going to avoid Corsair altogether from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Shariq Shaikh

customer_reviews.title: Great overall keyboard, no regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Very good keyboard, lighting is cool, extremely in depth app to control it, don’t really care too much for it, just needed a good keyboard for lots of programming. Took a notch off only because compared to my previous k70 (red leds), it is a tad more flimsy it seems... just a tad. Not enough to bother me day to day, but my left ctrl key would pop off sometimes mid type lol. Seems the key caps come off a bit too easily compared to the 1st gen k70. Fyi my first gen just literally died overnight after about 4ish years. Hopefully this will fare better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Solid
customer_reviews.text: If you like the aesthetic of being on a proper mechanical keyboard, then this is for you. This one is built of aircraft aluminum and has a pleasing low actuation force of at 55 cN (resistance) and a 2 mm throw (how far you need to press before it registers a keystroke). The keyboard has various light settings (nice when working in the dark) and has a USB pass-through port. On the geek side, there are also several dedicated multi-media wheels and buttons. I do admit that I love the volume wheel. If you don't need all the RGB colors, save 50 bucks and grab this one.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Larose

customer_reviews.title: CUE 2.x is not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: Drives everyone in the office crazy with the loud keys but it is as close to the old selectric type writers that I used in my youth. It gives me a reason to keep the office door closed. I have used CUE 1.x and CUE 2.x. I have no idea why they would take so many features out of software that was almost perfect for programming the keyboard. If you get this keyboard, download CUE 1.x if you want to have complete control over the keyboard. Use 2.x if you just like pretty keys.
customer_reviews.author: Hickabilly

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects and Freezes
customer_reviews.text: Had this keyboard for about a year. Every few weeks it will disconnect and computer needs to be restarted. Every few months the keyboard will freeze and needs to be disconnected from the computer before it starts working again. It is a PITA and extremely annoying. I have multiple Corsair devices including a case, and most have experienced some sort of a defect or failure. Corsair is no longer a name that stands for quality. RAM and Power Supply had not issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: N. Germin

customer_reviews.title: Persistent key chatter
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, and both have developed a habit of double- or triple-sending some keystrokes after a year or so, which is not really acceptable considering that it's a $150 keyboard, and I have decade old Dell keyboards that can still handle setting one symbol for one keypress. I like a lot of the features of the keyboard, but none of those really matter if it can't handle... typing.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron

customer_reviews.title: I love the look and feel of the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard (with MX Brown) to replace the same keyboard with MX Red keys. I love the look and feel of the keyboard. I really like the fact that cleaning it is as simple as blowing air between the keys. Because the sides are open, anything (doritos anyone?) will just fall right out. The reason I switched to the brown was that I felt the red were just TOO easy to press. I type on the keyboard as much as I game and just brushing by keys would sometimes register a keystroke while typing. The brown put just enough of a 'click' in the middle to make that not happen nearly as often.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality but terrible assembly
customer_reviews.text: This may not be the norm but my keyboard came basically disassembled with almost all of the keys off the board loose in the box. There was no damage to the delivery box which tells me that this came from Corsair like this. I had to reattach the keys which took..... a long time. Still, once I got the keys on the keyboard worked perfectly and feels great. Overall very happy with it but can only give 3 stars because of the horrible assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: K70 LUX is a must buy.
customer_reviews.text: Loving the cherry mx brown switches. Corsair has done an excellent job with the LUX version of this keyboard. The stabilization of the larger keys (shift, space, enter, etc.) is essentially invisible (as compared to earlier versions of the K70 where the underlying support for the key (not the switch!) would rattle around a bit when the key was pressed. I really like the larger lit area for each symbol per key, too. For me, this aids in usability of the keyboard. I have not touched any of the programmable features of the keyboard, including backlighting animations, etc. As usual, the cloth covered USB cord is substantial and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Buck

customer_reviews.title: minus one star
customer_reviews.text: Love this Keyboard, got the brown keys I think and they seem great! edit Wow I have had this keyboard since March of 2017, and it is by far the best keyboard i have ever had, it is my first mechanical keyboard. Anyhow minus one star since the letters on the keys have started to scratch off, just replaced the a s d and w keys that came as extras with the keyboard, but still need to replaced the O L M and N keys, i may have to contact Corsair to get those if its possilble at all, so for now down to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Carcosa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard, isnt quite like it states.
customer_reviews.text: You definitely pay for what you get these days. This is a very nice keyboard and easy to clean. It has a different feel than most keyboards though. The button key presses are loud and not quite like the description says. I probably would of gone with a different keyboard if I knew how loud it is. I would recommend this keyboard if you don't mind the noise it makes when you type.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt of Marines

customer_reviews.title: First experience with mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: First time using a mechanical keyboard - takes a little to get used to. Keys are bit louder, but it's accurate, can take multiple inputs at a time, and cleans easily. You can pop off the keys and put them back on quickly. They give you a different color WASD keys too if you wanna look like a real gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Terra Universalis

customer_reviews.title: good hardware, horrible software.
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard but serious this corsair utility engine sw has the most horrible/confusing UI I've ever seen. I've been trying to figure out how to set keyboard to a certain profile when my blank screen saver/monitor sleep mode kicks but to no avail, try goggle it there's lot of threads for such an obvious function but we've to resort to using some 3rd party utility such simple functionality (which I still can't either of them to work). Seriously corsair your sw fails, miserably.
customer_reviews.author: waver

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, that's it.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and works well most of the time. Occasionally when adjusting volume with the roller it locks into a continuous volume adjustment in the direction you are going. This locks the entire keyboard and either locks your volume all the way up or all the way down. The only solution I've found so far is to unplug the keyboard from the computer and plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Michael edward wood

customer_reviews.title: Key caps SUCK.
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use this keyboard for anything outside of light gaming every now and then, consider a different keyboard. I have had this keyboard for almost a year now and I have had to replace numerous keys on my mine. This is due to the key stems being very thin, and low quality. I ended up buying reinforced key caps and replacing all of them. Aside from that, the volume controls are great, I like the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice red keyboard, good for typing and gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I got the version with the Cherry MX Brown keys. Lacking as much resistance as the Blues, this is a fast keyboard. The keys feel good and aren't very wobbly. The whole thing is solid and basic. You probably indeed could kill someone with it, not that I recommend that.The lighting is very sharp--the letters and numbers really pop, even on the lower settings, and you don't have light leaking all around the keys. The lighting and the build are top reasons to get this keyboard. You also don't have to fool around with any Corsair software to use the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christian

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard for quieter environments
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for Christmas, but after trying it for myself I may need one for my own set up. The key are feel good to press with tactile feedback, and the included grippy keys make gaming enjoyable too. The quite touch keys; while still louder then a cheaper membrane keyboard; aren't so loud they would disrupt the silence of a busy office. The RGB for the keyboard is easily turned off using keys, and the usb passthrough makes using short cabled devices a breeze. A strong recommendation for anyone looking to get into mechanical keyboards, but often use their keyboard around others who wouldn't enjoy the clicky sounds of a Cherry MX Red or such
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bearce

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason these are so popular
customer_reviews.text: It's a well-built keyboard, it has good LED lighting, and the cables are sturdy. My only complaint is that the positioning of the LED lights in each key means that they have to put the capital letter below the lowercase which is reversed. That took some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this keyboard while at work. The brown tactile switches are louder than I expected. I don't get complaints from my coworkers about it, but I do worry about the sound when typing long emails; however, the switches feel nice and works really well compared to my old keyboard with Romper G switches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonweb

customer_reviews.title: Solid Keyboard, Dreadful keycaps
customer_reviews.text: While the Corsair K-70 is a solid keyboard, I ended up returning mine for a replacement due to the keycaps all cracking on the stem (even the keys I rarely used) only to have the replacement have the exact same issue. I liked the keyboard enough to hang on to it and decided to buy the upgraded "Double-Shot keycaps" from Corsair for another $50.00 thinking this would solve the problem only to have those all crack as well. Unfortunately Corsair has a non standard bottom row of buttons (I'm sure to sell more keycaps) so buying from another brand is not an option. Now the keyboard is sitting on a shelf with all my other unused hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Willard Rueckert

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard not recognized by the UEFI
customer_reviews.text: Could not finish booting my computer as the keyboard wouldn't be recognized by the UEFI (bios) (Dell desktop). Have many other keyboards all of them boot fine not this one. I tried all remedies none worked. Keyboard needs to install device drivers for it to work in Windows. The keys felt smaller, clunky and it took a while to get used to the keyboard. Special characters are not placed in an intuitive manner. Didn't like the feel of the brown Cherry keys, at all. Returned the keyboard. I switched back to my 10-year old worn out keyboard G15 from Logitech which is superior.
customer_reviews.author: George Soto

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, terrible software.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard looks and feels great. Build quality seems good. Software is terrible. It has a pretty clunky user interface and it is extremely flaky. Never loads profiles correctly. Sometimes randomizes keystrokes. Stick to buying Corsair products that don't require software.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Would have been perfect...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard would be 5 stars if it functioned properly. I cannot reliably type a "P" because this expensive garbage either repeats the key three times or misses it entirely. Completely dissatisfied with this purchase. UPDATE: Amazon exchanged this defective keyboard for one that functions perfectly. Best keyboard I've had in a long time as far as keystrokes are concerned. Minus 1 star for a lackluster wrist rest and poor quality control that resulted in defective keyboards being sent to customers.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great middle range keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Not the best and brightest but I love mine so far. Keys fee great and sound awesome. My wife was worried about the colicky sounds but is fine with this as these keys aren’t too loud. Color is fine but you can get better for more money. I’m happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jazan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: ** 7 month update ** Lights just flicker uncontrollably now. Pro's + Does all the expected Keyboard stuff + volume control is great Cons - White shines through blurry keycaps in various tints instead of actual white and it isn't uniform across the keys - Lights aren't as bright as they are on some competitors - When the PC is locked, you're stuck with the 3 built in rainbow color schemes, no way to make it custom - iCue software is an abomination
customer_reviews.author: NotTheDroid

customer_reviews.title: all busness, no gimmicks, awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I lost my logitech G710+ in a fire, so i needed to find a replacement, i was really disappointed i couldnt find the 710+ again. but this corsair offered the same cherry brown set up so i figured id give it a try. its like having my old, perfect, keyboard back again, only better. Yes i miss the Macro keys on the left but that's my only beef. This keyboard is all business, no gimmicks, its just right. seems really well made with metal accents, keys seem like great quality. The dimmable LEDs are obnoxiously bright when you turn them down.
customer_reviews.author: KevinNJ

customer_reviews.title: The Worst $140 I ever spent !
customer_reviews.text: The keys are constantly popping off. There is NO feedback feel from the switches ! The symbols should be ABOVE the numbers. Not below. You SHIFT to use the UPPER symbols. This is backwards, and highly annoying. Brightness is NOT highly adjustable, it only has a FEW settings. Software is NOT easy to use. It is NOT user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: David Webb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard, all I could ask for!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely astounding keyboard. The feeling of typing is like no other, and rightfully so. It feels crisp and responsive. The anti-ghosting is also very helpful. The lighting actually surprised me. As it is only red, i expected only one shade of red in a static keylighting, but I was wrong. The patterns and shade of red can be customized fully, which pleased me very much. The brushed aluminum body feels sturdy and heavy, which keeps it from sliding all over the desk. The more open design makes cleaning a breeze as well. Overall, a 10/10 keyboard that will be perfect for anyone either gaming or writing/typing.
customer_reviews.author: Acbbboston

customer_reviews.title: K70 LUX.  Should be your first and maybe your last mechanical gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I have used ergonomic keyboards for years. Probably about 15+ years. I have been a keyboard bigot. However, I have lusted for mechanical keyboards and this Cherry MX Brown equipped, red-backlit K70 LUX has been absolutely amazing. Maybe try a Cherry MX Red for something quieter next time, but this is the best feeling gaming keyboard I have ever used. The extras like the "Rain" animation (this Matrix-style cascade of lights) is just too freaking cool. My wrists be damned, you only game with one hand anyway if you're doing it right.
customer_reviews.author: FLY1NGSQU1RR3L

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It does what you want... typing. The color variety, and settings are enjoyable. I do find it odd that every so often the software that controls my keyboard and water-cooler requires a reboot after an update. I do wish that it was more silent then it is, as it does make more noise then your standard "Shipped with your computer" keyboard. But i do enjoy it. I also wish the key distance "throw" was shorter, but that's a personal opinion. But overall, i do enjoy this keyboard, and feel like i made a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I have only ever used membrane keyboards up to this point. The difference is truly night and day. Each key has a satisfying click to it when you are typing for good feedback, keys don't get stuck if you push a little to hard, and sounds awesome when you are clacking away. If had the choice again I would buy the RGB version instead of the solid color just for the cool factor and customization, but I have a red theme going anyways and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Softest yet durable gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The overall feel to it when i first got it was that it was so soft, it felt like i was pressing on a whole marshmellow. The overall build quality on this thing is well detailed and IT REALLY DOES FEEL SOFT (personally). The volume and extra buttons work well nothing wrong with that, great for MMO gaming (i play FFXIV on gilgamesh if ya'll are wondering). Backlit wise, its adjustable so im not really concerned with the brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Veron Tan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely top of the line quality!
customer_reviews.text: () Arrived 2 hours earlier, good packaging and perfect condition. The brushed aluminum frame feel great to the touch, the keys very smooth, responsive and overall sturdy. The rest of the fun is in the software with all the effects. However I do feel a bit of regret for not buying the RGB version, simply because of having the option to choose the back-lit colors of the keyboard. With more colors you can match the keyboard to your setup, and if a color is distracting you can always change it, and there is also more community support for the lighting effects. Overall, i'm extremely satisfied with the purchase and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product early December 2019, and the space bar started failing 6 months later. I game around 3 hrs a day and this keyboard could not with stand that duration. I would suggest looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos M.

customer_reviews.title: First class keyboard experience
customer_reviews.text: I love this Corsair K70 keyboard. I've always bought cheapo keyboards in the past, but man... It feels like flying first class instead of economy. I love the way it feels to type and look and feel of it. I can never go back to less worthy keyboards after this. All the years wasted typing on inferior keyboards!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hilsdon

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply the best keyboard I have ever owned. I think I FINALLY found a keyboard where the keys will not rub off over time. Solid construction, heavy and comfortable to use. My only complaint (not really a complaint - more of a curious observation) is that the numbers and symbols are inverted from a standard keyboard... Example: the 1 is on top of the ! instead of the other way around. Kind of threw me off a bit at first use.
customer_reviews.author: Painted Shadows

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase ... No complains.
customer_reviews.text: The sound control is incredibly practical and this is a very nice and solid feel for this mechanical keyboard exactly what I was looking for after getting another where the keys felt wobbly this one is absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.author: HLD

customer_reviews.title: No issues for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Easy to clean thanks to the open sides. Backlight is adjustable, which means it's easy to use in all lighting conditions. I've had this keyboard over a year now and there's no mechanical issues at all. Corsair includes some key caps of an alternate design for WASD and space just in case they'd suit you more than the stock key caps, which is nice. I just have to be careful to type very quietly at night so I don't annoy the girlfriend with the tactile clickity-clack of the switches.
customer_reviews.author: Cody W.

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard right out of the box. The keyboard is very sturdy and feels great. I love the included wrist pad. LED lights look great. Only complaint (and it seems that many people have said this) is that the Corsair program for the LEDs is pretty terrible... It's not impossible to use, but it does take a while.
customer_reviews.author: Edison

customer_reviews.title: old school clicky feel & sound
customer_reviews.text: If you can remember the IBM Selectric manual typewriter, this keyboard get as close to that as I've found. No problems at all with build quality or anything else. Solid performer. My only "wish" would be to include a white keyboard backlight option instead of just the red which I find to be a little harsh. They make a blue but didn't see that option on AMZN when I ordered. Highly recommended for general office work.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy B.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for work to increase productivity
customer_reviews.text: I'm typing on their K70 LUX at home and had to get a similar one for the office, no comparison. Wrist rest is a huge bonus and the metal construction feels fantastic. Will buy Corsair keyboards in the future.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good keys. Light build.
customer_reviews.text: Great to have the cherry brown keys but the build quality feels lighter than the Rosewill keyboard. Hat being said, the leds are nice. They have different effects. The keyboard is aluminum. The functions work fine. The corsair software is a big install and uses more ram than I'd expect. I ended up taking off the wrist rest and using a standalone. I didn't like how it slowed down so much. It wasn't really a place where my palms or wrists were stationary.
customer_reviews.author: Kutter1

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, fair price, love the Cherry Browns
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Full layout, but still not too large because of the slim frame and no wasted space. Real Cherry MX Brown switches give just the right amount of satisfying click without being distractingly loud. Comes with optional software, but it's not necessary for keyboard functionality.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very well-built keyboard. Not too clicky (but certainly not silent). The single USB 2.0 pass-though port is in an odd place, accessible on the back of the keyboard. Myhas a USB port on the right side, a bit easier to access than on the back side. Both of these keyboards are excellent and virtually identical to me - heavy, well-made and tactile.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Corsair products so after a bit of arguing with myself about the price, I finally decided to buy this keyboard. I don't regret it. The brown switches suite my needs perfectly the minor clickyness of the keyboard is very satisfying while programming, and very smooth while gaming. There are many options for lighting, I opted for a low level light that ripples outward from any keystroke. The keyboard feels very well built. Ill be using Corsair keyboards from now on.
customer_reviews.author: PCHarlow

customer_reviews.title: Kool
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my Mac. I have very large hands and a heavy impact when I type. I like the tactile feel much better than the little weeny Mac keyboard and this mechanical thing seems to hold up under pressure.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mayton

customer_reviews.title: Got this as she did not need all the color fun. But the testimate here is that this our ...
customer_reviews.text: Son has the RGB version. Wife is going to grad school and wanted the same keyboard for herself as she uses another computer. Got this as she did not need all the color fun. But the testimate here is that this our second K70 No issues, very happy. My son is a heavy gamer, his K70 RGB also has had ZERO issues.
customer_reviews.author: RCJHKU

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just received this keyboard as a replacement for my old razer blackwidow and I regret not picking this up sooner. The keys feel very precise and work well for both gaming and word processing. The media buttons are surprisingly useful, and the volume scroll wheel is a fantastic feature. I highly recommend this keyboard to anyone looking for something that is good at everything and does not need or want the RGB lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Pat P.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! Best for gamers!
customer_reviews.text: Very good keyboard so far. Feels really well built as it should feel for the price. Only negative is, it seems to get dirty/dusty way quicker than my previous keyboards. Or maybe dust just shows easier on this one.
customer_reviews.author: John Falsey

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing, it dose not slide at all, perfect for gamin
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard so much I love all of it's features and its RGB, it has an amazing utility engine and there are so many different lighting effects and you can customize this keyboard so much. I had no idea this keyboard came with it's own gaming keys for W A S D Q E R F they are amazing and make me a better gamer and that volume knob is easy to use fast. I recommend this keyboard 100% its so worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rains

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for what you get compared to other mechanical keyboards. Doesn't have that nice 'click' when tapping a key like a Razor e.g.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Jacques

customer_reviews.title: amazing keyboard by corsair
customer_reviews.text: i love corsair's keyboards, they're amazing and comftrouble to use, durable as well, and lets not forget, amazing RGB lights! 10/10 for this keyboard and whole brand, thank you corsair for making such amazing keyboards!
customer_reviews.author: Antra

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this keyboard. I like that it is responsive and makes a little clacking noise as I type. I wasn't sure if I would like the lit buttons, but they are great. I don't have to have the lights on nor do I have to strain to see the letters when I type. I particularly like the rolling volume control. It is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: aa284

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality but some key has problems after a week use
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality and has good tactical feedback and fast response time. BUT my unit has issues with Escape, left control and space-bar key issues as they go down and does not come up( btw nothing contaminated my keyboard), Extremely annoying for a quality branded expensive product
customer_reviews.author: Imran321

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-end keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels like a premium product with durable materials and keys that have a deliberate feel to them. It's not quiet, so if you're looking for something in low noise environments, it's probably not your best option. But for my needs (gaming and software development) it's very much worth the higher price point.
customer_reviews.author: John McCann

customer_reviews.title: Love my keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this keyboard. You can customize which keys are lit. It also has a volume control and mute button on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Annette L. Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Step down from the MK1
customer_reviews.text: This is still a solid keyboard but compared to the mk1, it's a step down. There is more plastic in the construction and the keys "sound" cheaper. I could recommend if it was closer to 100, but really a step down from the mk1.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher  Lirot

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: works as a mechanical keyboard should work. Cons: spacebar is not as smooth as it should be. Backspace key seems to very occasionally hang up if I hit it and another key at the same time by accident. No idea why.
customer_reviews.author: relevantslim

customer_reviews.title: NOT quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice keyboard, but if anyone is buying it because the product name currently states "Tactile & Quiet", be aware that this keyboard is NOT quiet at all. The description accurately states the there's an audible click, but I was totally misled by the title. This is the loudest keyboard I've ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Kettle1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard, I can type super fast on it ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome keyboard, I can type super fast on it and love the response of the keys. The volume wheel at the top should be mandatory on all keyboards! My only complaint is I wish they put it on the other side of the keyboard so you can keep your hand on the mouse as it's almost faster to just click on your volume icon on the computer and raise it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell N.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. Feels quality. Couple months in still one of the best keyboards I’ve used. The constitution feels great and the variable light brightness makes for using this at night without having the lights on great.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Martin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, very responsive, not as loud as my other gaming keyboard thus the reason for purchasing this one. Got it on sale for black Friday got a great deal. Not complaints. Nice thick woven cord comes with one USB port at keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: jlm805

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After trying the best of Razer and Steelseries, Corsair has the best keyboard for gaming. The wrist rest is fantastic but doesn’t make your wrist hit like the leather on the Razer and the textured ASWD keys are a once you’ve had them you can’t go back kinda thing. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P Balm

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, but beware of power outages
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this keyboard is fantastic, except that when the power goes out I need to climb under my desk to unplug it from my PC and then plug it back in or it will not respond to any input. Thankfully I don't get power outages often, however when I was having work done on my house almost every week last month it was quite obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: S. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard does not retain settings if computer crashes. Lacks onboard memory for settings..
customer_reviews.text: When I had a outage and my computer didn't shut off properly my settings were lost. I had to resort to and old keyboard to get back on the computer. I have liked the Corsair brand up to this keyboard. I got so tired of it that I bought a Redragon about a month ago and am quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Salem Oregon Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Great aesthetics, great effective keyboard. Gamers must buy.
customer_reviews.text: I game with it. Excellent, not as clackity-clack as the other gaming keyboards (not red category i think, a more subdued sound but just perfect for someone like me). Very little ghost stroking happening, holding up well. Came with additional gaming keys (AWSD) and as importantly, a numberpad as well as a wrist rest that’s smooth and comfortable. Over all great design. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Xue

customer_reviews.title: Action is great, keys pop off WAY too easily.
customer_reviews.text: I love the action on these switches, but damn do they come off far too easily. I've had the D key pop off during only slightly heated strafing, and the ~, numb-, numb+, Esc, and numbEnter keys all pop off and fly into orbit as I brush my hand against them. Don't even think about putting this keyboard into a backpack without some kind of protection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son as a Christmas gift and half the lights don't work already. For the price this is unacceptable and there's no warranty or support already!!! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: but i love how tactile and quiet they are
customer_reviews.text: not crazy about the font on the keys, but i love how tactile and quiet they are. it's convenient having media/volume control right on the keyboard as well, and the spare usb port in the back is pretty handy. i love my new keyboard :)
customer_reviews.author: chanzilla

customer_reviews.title: Puke Resistant !
customer_reviews.text: I'm not usually one to take the time to type out reviews but wow, after the night I had with this thing I knew I had to. To put it short, I ended up puking all over my keyboard (this very one,) computer monitor, everywhere... there were chicken chunks, man! It was bad. After I finally cleaned everything I was AMAZED I got it working again the next morning after it dried out. The VERY NEXT DAY I spilled some bong water on it and it is STILL working like a damn charm
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Will become your daily driver. Best board and at an awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: My daily driver. Keys feel amazing. I am waiting on Corsair to make something a little more compact, even more than the K63. Something like a 60% board would be amazing. This board has zero flaws and everyone who sees it in my office wants to touch it and type on it. Typing on it isn't the quickest for me as I don't have the largest hands but the feel is superb either way.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price. Not "audible click" if that's what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mech keyboard for the price, the MX Cherry Brown switches are authentic and feel really good, I'm usually a MX Clear guy but Brown was all that was left in stock on sale, and I'm pleased, and i knew what to expect from Browns. The description says "audible click" yes it's has the click you'd expect from the keycap hitting the switch with no bumper, but no actual click noise like an MX Blue or Green, which is exactly what i expected from an MX Brown
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rocka

customer_reviews.title: Meets all my requirements.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, it meets every requirement I wanted. It is a solid build quality, the keys feel very nice and the cord is braided, which I like. The model I am rating doesn't have RGB but it is cheaper than the version that does, but doesn't sacrifice on quality. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: DespicableMe

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend (start repeating keys “voluntarily”)
customer_reviews.text: The product stop working properly in little over 3 months. Being a keyboard relatively expensive, I found this unacceptable unless appropriate remedies exists. I have written to the manufacturer to find out.
customer_reviews.author: L Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB options + extras!
customer_reviews.text: The RGB options for this are really fun. Great tactile feedback on the keys and they aren't too loud either. The USB passthrough is nice for extra peripherals. Have not had any problems with this so far!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Y.

customer_reviews.title: 10/10. Have just been tickled pink with this keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: 10/10. Have just been tickled pink with this keyboard. Fast smooth typing, can use it at night (huge plus for me), volume scroll is lovely and being able to take the keys off to clean has been a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard Chatter
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use, keyboard chatter has happened on the "E" key, one of the most important and prominent buttons in games. Keyboard Chatter is when you press a key and it registers twice like thiis or eeat. Annoying, and I had to get software for it. I'm very bummed out.. I was planning to have this keyboard for atleast 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Captain

product_meta.title: CORSAIR K70 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - USB Passthrough & Media Controls - Tactile & Quiet - Cherry MX Brown
product_meta.description: Color:Red LEDThe K70 LUX has Cherry MX Brown switches backed by a lightweight aluminum chassis. CUE enabled advanced lighting control and large font keycaps deliver dynamic, vibrant backlighting
feature_bullets: CUE support enables advanced macro and lighting programming for virtually unlimited game customization / 100% Cherry MX Brown key switches with tactile feedback and an audible click
Aircraft-grade anodized brushed aluminum frame for superior durability / Advanced lighting control and large font keycaps deliver dynamic, vibrant backlighting
100% anti-ghosting with full key rollover on USB / Detachable soft-touch wrist rest and dedicated multimedia controls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars702 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
